Dracon slips into the elevator, staying silent and simply listening in on t=
he conversation.
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Nic 
  To: nbwrpg@=
yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, June 06, 2003 11:02 PM
  Subject: Re: The =
new Contract


  Krhinos entered an elevator and signaled his two other com=
panions to
  follow him.

  Krhinos: No matter. They must all have been too=
 drunk to notice
  anyways. The point is, though, that we are going on a mi=
ssion and we
  bring in a full mining and processing station with us. Outpo=
st on
  planet, space relay. In short, the full monty! This is one heck of =
a
  contract!

  --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrot=
e:
  > --Rukus--
  > 
  > "Lead on. Keep an eye out for tails." Rukus eyes =
the crowd as he 
  > speaks. No bots attracted notice under his careful scr=
utiny, but 
  > that didn't mean anything. "We weren't being descrete, so u=
nwelcome 
  > eyes may have wavered our way."
  > 
  > 
  > --- In nbwrpg@y=
ahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
  > > Dracon made no=
 gestures and remained blank in the face, almost to 
  > the point of appea=
ring to be sinister.
  > > 
  > > "If it's important...then let's go," he s=
aid, agreeing with 
  > Krhinos, "we should discuss this ordeal furthermore=
 amongst 
  > ourselves..."
  > >   ----- Original Message ----- 
  > >   F=
rom: Nic 
  > >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  > >   Sent: Thursday, June =
05, 2003 10:26 PM
  > >   Subject: Re: The new Contract
  > > 
  > > 
  > >=
   Krhinos watched the lithe bot come close and sneaking past the 
  > crow=
d.
  > > 
  > >   Krhinos: Rukus, right? Good then. I guess this is the who=
le of 
  > the
  > >   crew. I'd tell you more about this mission, but not =
in here. Too 
  > many
  > >   ears and I don't trust about all of them. Su=
ffice it to say, your
  > >   paycheck is sitting calmly on the mobile stat=
ion and you are 
  > eligible
  > >   to 3.75% of the profits we make on th=
is operation. The number 
  > might
  > >   seem low, but wait for the real=
 thing! Now come along and let's 
  > go
  > >   somewhere more private.
  =
> > 
  > >   Ironically, he was saying this precise sentence in the precise=
 
  > place
  > >   and to the precise poeple in which circumstances it see=
med 
  > weird. In
  > >   fact, one of the pleasure bots was saying the sa=
me thing to a 
  > drunken
  > >   miner who was nearly passed out on the f=
loor. Lucky for her, the 
  > guy
  > >   had already paid her, twice rathe=
r than once, drunk as he was.
  > >
